subject: Re: Non Plus Ultra Coverage Measure?
messageBody:
> Sure, Paul Johnson wrote up some information on that:
>
http://homepage.hispeed.ch/pjcj/testing_and_code_coverage/paper.html
>
> Specifically:
>
http://homepage.hispeed.ch/pjcj/testing_and_code_coverage/paper.html#
what_covera
> ge_metrics_to_use_and_what_percentages_to_aim_for
>
> There's lots of stuff out there relevant to your questions
(accessible via
> Google), in lots of professional journals, and books on testing
(e.g., any of
> Boris Beizer's books).
>
> Y'know?
>
> Scott Stirling
> Framingham, MA

Whats the name of the measure which covers everything which must be
tested, if one wants to test everything.

I mean if bugless tests are written to the that perfect measure and
all test execute green, then there is no bug in the tested code I
think.

Is such a perfect measure existing?
